lead_paragraph: ALFORD--Ann Bernhard, of Saddle River, NJ passed away peacefully surrounded by family on June 6, 2016 at the age of 87. She was a dedicated philanthropist, whose leadership was marked by grace, persistence, and an unwavering commitment to the charities she supported. She joined the Valley Hospital Foundation Board in 1994 and served as a Trustee of The Valley Hospital Foundation for 12 years. Nine of those years were as an Officer of the Board, including serving as Chairman for three years. She graduated, Phi Beta Kappa from Wells College in 1949 and later served on the Wells College Board of Trustees from 1994 to 2001. Ann served as Chair of the West Bergen Mental Healthcare Foundation Board of Trustees from 2007 to 2010 and currently serves as a Trustee. She also currently serves on the Forum School Board of Trustees. Ann had a passion for music and the arts and was a patron of The Metropolitan Opera, Parlance Chamber Concerts, American Ballet Theatre, and the Roundabout Theatre Company. Married to her late, beloved husband, George Edward Alford for 29 years Ann was devoted to her family. She is survived by her brother, Berl Bernhard; her daughters, Maria Alford Suehnholz and Elizabeth Alford Hogan; stepdaughters, Patricia Alford President, Carolyn Alford Cason, and Katherine Alford: grandchildren, George Alford Suehnholz, Michael Raymond Suehnholz, Lindsey Alford Hogan, Graham Patrick Hogan, AJ Johnson and predeceased grandson Justin Alford President. In lieu of flowers, donations should be sent to the Valley Hospital Foundation, Ridgewood, NJ or the National Foundation for Animal Rescue. 1/3
